Row.Text: You stand in the land of the Herero! I am Jacob Morenga, and I defend my brethren in these lands. Are you friend or foe?
Kill me if you must, but know that - even in my absence - my men will fight you to the last.
It is to be war, then? Very well. My men shall strand you in the desert and let your blood spill upon the sands.
Just as I have brought the Herero together with the Nama, so too do I see the potential for alliance between our two peoples. Shall we make a public Declaration of Friendship?
I can be silent no longer about your crimes against my people. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
I can only protect my people by striking preemptively against those who would do them harm.
If you do not relinquish your claim to Herero lands, we will have no choice but to retaliate by force.
You are brave, to meet me in person. Come to fight, or just to surrender?
I am pleased to see you. Come, join me by the fire.
What brings you to the land of the Herero today?
It is always an unfortunate day when I am forced to see your face. What is it you want?
Your army is quite impressive... but be aware that I will not be cowed by threats.
Speak, then.
My people have suffered, but we are not broken.
My people have come to value your goods nearly as much as they value their cattle. Shall we make a deal?
Unfortunately, after everything that has transpired, I can no longer allow there to be peace between us.
Would you be interested in an Open Borders agreement? My cattle herders must be permitted to roam freely.
Do not mock me.
Our enemies seek to starve and destroy us, but with your assistance, the Herero may yet grow strong again.
There are times when a man must make enemies. However, you have not chosen your enemy wisely today.
Fleeing already? Come, let us at least have a proper fight first.
Let these events be a lesson for all those who would seek to wrong the Herero.
